home.message: We are very aware that New Zealand is a long way for a large number of the people we care about. There is zero pressure to join. With this in mind - we will have a reception in Ghent in Summer ‘24.

schedule.location: Tony (Sam’s Dad) has helped replant land in Whangapoua with Native Bush. The ceremony will take place there, followed by a reception in a marquee on Waipapa Place.
schedule.outro: More information will be provided closer to the date

faqs.title: Where to stay
details: For those looking to rent a house Booka Bach or AirBnb are good options. There are also various local facebook group that you could reach out on.
Houses can also be rented in Martarangi, which is a 30 minute drive away. Note it will be difficult to get a late night taxi back from Whangapoua so something will likely need to be pre-arranged.
Cabins and Camping: Whangapoua Holiday Park: 5 kms from the wedding site (think about getting a van to drive people back and forth). Nice Cabins and amenities - Whangapoua Holiday Park
Earls’ Paradise: This is a camping ground on land owned by a local, in Whangapoua itself. I think it is camping only.
We will also potentially have various lawns and sections for people to pitch a tent on. Please reach out if you would like to know more.

faqs.title: Whangapoua Amenities
details: Whangapoua is a small beach settlement, with only one small general store that sells basic food (decent pies) supplies, baked goods, coffee, limited alcohol, petrol and diesel. We suggest bringing with you enough food and drinks for the weekend (Saturday night and Sunday afternoon is on us) as the closest townships are Coromandel (20 minutes) and Whitianga (approx. 30 minutes).

If you are passing through Thames, PAKn’SAVE is located at 100 Mary Street and opening hours are 8am - 8pm. Liquorland, Liquor King and Thames Liquor Centre are located on Pollen Street. Opening hours vary, all closing by 9.30pm. Wine, beer, and Pals will be provided at the wedding alongside some top shelf later in the night. Sunday - BYO.

faqs.title: Dress Code
details: No shirt, no shoes, no free drinks.

faqs.title: Gifts
details: Look, we know alot of you are traveling a LONG way. That is appreciated, and all we are really after.
With that in mind no gifts are necessary. However, if you wish to give a gift, we will gratefully accept a small contribution towards a honeymoon.

faqs.title: Kids
details: Kids are welcome at the ceremony and at the pizza party on Sunday. Many of you have a little  addition to the family that needs specific care. We will make a space available for feeds etc.The reception is not likely suitable for Kids, but babies on the arm / boob are obviously welcome.

faqs.title: To those traveling from abroad
details: NZeTA is an electronic travel authority for those entering from a visa waiver country. Link below.
If you are traveling via the USA you need to apply for an ESTA. Even if you are just transiting through! Link below
For both of these visas, make sure you are using the links above - third party websites exist that can make the process annoying!

faqs.title: Parking / Getting Around
details: As Whangapoua is only a small place, you shouldn’t have to far to travel/ walk between your accommodation and where the reception will be held.

Parking is limited, so would suggest walking if possible or carpooling with others. For those who will be driving, please do not park on the driveway of Waipapa Place. The best locations to park, would either be on the main road, or in the small carpark down the very northern end of the beach, near the ceremony and reception locations.

diet.title: Do you have any dietary requirements?
